thread.title: Photos: Patriots fans celebrate Super Bowl victory in streets of Boston
thread.title_full: Photos: Patriots fans celebrate Super Bowl victory in streets of Boston

title: Photos: Patriots fans celebrate Super Bowl victory in streets of Boston
text:
Photos: Patriots fans celebrate Super Bowl victory in streets of Boston Photos: Patriots fans celebrate Super Bowl victory in streets of Boston The party started late Sunday night and continued into early Monday morning. AP, 2:18 AM 
Get Patriots game stats and the inside scoop on the season with The Boston Globe's Point After newsletter delivered for free to your inbox. Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement 
BOSTON (AP) — New England Patriots fans have taken to the streets of Boston to celebrate their team’s 34-28 dramatic overtime Super Bowl win over the Atlanta Falcons. 
Hundreds of fans gathered late Sunday night and early Monday morning in Boston Common, a downtown public park. 
They were dancing, cheering and chanting “Brady.” Police also were there to make sure the celebrations didn’t get out of hand. There were no immediate reports of any problems and fans were mostly described as being well-behaved. 
Democratic Boston Mayor Marty Walsh took to Twitter late Sunday to congratulate the Patriots and announce the victory parade, which is scheduled for Tuesday morning. 
Boston police tweeted their thanks “to all the fans who acted like champions tonight” and wrote that they would see them again on Tuesday. Advertisement
